short_summary: Print material production and preparation for distribution for 2026 Census and 2024 Census Behaviour Tests.
description: Public Works and Government Services Canada has a requirement to complete the print material production and preparation for distribution requirements for the 2026 Census of Canada (inclusive of both the Census of Population and the Census of Agriculture) in May - July, 2026, and its associated 2024 Census Behaviour Tests (BTs) in May 2024 in the approved timelines.
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
Statistics Canada 2024 Census Behaviour Test and 2026 Census ACAN

### Summary
Public Works and Government Services Canada is seeking a contractor to print and distribute materials for the 2024 Census Behaviour Tests and the 2026 Census of Canada.

### Details
* **Tender Reference Number:** WS3479822336-Doc4246740925
* **Date of Publication:** October 6, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date:** October 26, 2023, at 14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** December 6, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** May 25, 2022 (Note: seems to be an error. No further information is included about this date)
* 
* Note that the tender has expired already. However, the vendor appears to have submitted tender materials and these may be useful in future tender exercises. 

### Tender Details
The primary requirement is the printing of materials related to the 2026 Census of Canada, including questionnaires, envelopes, and letters.

Required Services:

* Printing of census materials for the 2026 Census of Canada and the 2024 Census Behaviour Tests.
* Distribution of the materials by the approved timelines.

Disclaimer
Please note that this tender is an expired opportunity. The contracting entity, Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), is no longer accepting bids for this project.

To facilitate future bidder preparation, please consult the original tender document here: 
https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17649208?extsite=MTc2NDkyMDhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Contact
For confidential information on this request, contact Andrea Keyserlingk at andrea.keyserlingk@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

End-User Entity 
 The end-user entity for this project is Statistics Canada (StatCan).
 Location 
 150 Tunney's Pasture Driveway, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0T6, Canada.
